CatDescriptText: Mr. Chelsey Simmons, hotel steward, South Hills and Mr. Joseph A. James, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think there will be war over Berlin?"  Mr. Simmons' answer reads: "That's a tough one to figure out.  If I tried to tell you what I thought about it, I would have to write a book, and I still wouldn't have an answer, one way or another."  Mr. James' answer reads: "No, I don't think it's probable.  The person who starts it will know that it will probably bring about the end of the civilized world."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Chelsey Simmons wearing light colored short sleeved shirt standing with arms crossed, building in background; Portrait of Joseph A. James wearing plaid shirt and hat, building in background
